full_summary:
**Standard First Aid, CPR - Level C and Automated External Defibrillator (AED) Training and Recertification**
# Request for Proposal from the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP)
**Call ID:** PW-23-01029922
**Solicitation Number:** 202302449B
**Submission Deadline:** April 14, 2023, 2:00 p.m. Local Time

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) invites suitably qualified organizations to submit proposals for providing Standard First Aid, Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) - Level C, and Automated External Defibrillator (AED) training and recertification services for its personnel.

**Background:**
The RCMP requires a service provider to deliver the most recent First Aid and CPR techniques approved by the Minister of Labour in accordance with Part XVI of the Canada Occupational Health and Safety Regulations.

**Contract Period and Extendibility:**
The contract will be for a one-year period, with an irrevocable option to extend it for up to two additional one-year periods. The anticipated start date is April 2023.

**Selection Criteria and Evaluation:**
Bidders will be evaluated based on their ability to meet the requirements outlined in this solicitation. The selection method is Low-Priced Responsive Bid.

**Inclusions and Requirements:**
* Provide standard first aid and CPR training that meets the criteria outlined in the Canada Occupational Health and Safety Regulations.
* Recertification will be required annually.
* The service provider must provide qualified instructors to teach recent first aid and CPR techniques.
* The training must be aligned with industry standards.

**Submission Requirements:**
Proponents must submit their bids electronically, following the requirements outlined in the solicitation. The Government of Canada requires bidders to regularly consult the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) for updates on this solicitation.

**Business Opportunities for Indigenous Businesses:**
The RCMP encourages Indigenous businesses to participate in this procurement. For more information about the Federal Indigenous Business Directory (IBD) and eligibility criteria, visit: [www.canada.ca/indigenousbusinessdirectory](http://www.canada.ca/indigenousbusinessdirectory).

**Document of Record:**
Solicitation documents can be downloaded from the GETS website: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities.

Please submit any questions or inquiries related to this proposal to [Samantha.Giuliano@rcmp-grc.gc.ca](Samantha.Giul
